questions.text: Which state is home to the only diamond mine located in the USA?
questions.explanation:
Arkansas.

	It is located near Murfeesboro, Arkansas.

questions.text: Which state is home to the nation's tallest monument?
questions.explanation:
Missouri.

	The Gateway Arch in St. Loius is the nation's tallest monument.

questions.text: Which state claims to have hosted the world's first heavier-than-air flight?
questions.explanation:
North Carolina.

	The Wright Brother's plane lifted off the ground at Kitty Hawk on December 17,1903.

questions.text: What is the home state of the first US President born west of the Mississippi River?
questions.explanation:
Iowa.

	Herbert Hoover was born in West Branch, Iowa in 1874.

questions.text: Which state has the largest legislature of all the states?
questions.explanation:
New Hampshire.

	New Hampshire's legislature has over 400 members. If the U.S. Congress were in proportion it would have about 100,000 members.

questions.text: Which state was home to the first professional baseball team?
questions.explanation:
Ohio.

	The Cincinnati Red Stockings had the first team where every player was a paid professional. They beat the Mansfield Independents 48-14 in 1869.

questions.text: Which state has the world's largest portrait busts?
questions.explanation:
South Dakota.

	Mount Rushmore began in 1927 and was completed in 1941. It is one of South Dakota's major tourist attractions.

questions.text: What was the first state to accept the U.S. Constitution?
questions.explanation:
Delaware.

	Delaware ratified the Constitution on December 7, 1787.

questions.text: In which New England state is a lake with the longest place name in the United States?
questions.explanation:
Massachusetts & Ma.

	Lake Chargoggagoggmanchauggagoggchaubunagungamaugg is located near the town of Webster, Massachusetts, close to the border with Connecticut. It is also known as Lake Webster for those unable to remember 45 letters in its name. The name comes from an Algonquin language and means "Fishing Place at the Boundaries -- Neutral Meeting Grounds".

questions.text: What state has the oldest capital city in the United States?
questions.explanation:
New Mexico.

	Santa Fe, New Mexico was founded in the winter of 1609-1610 by Don Pedro de Peralta.

questions.text: In what state was the first rocket that put men on the moon built?
questions.explanation:
Alabama.

	In 1950 120 German scientists joined Dr. Werner von Braun in Huntsville. Their work made Huntsville, Alabama the 'Rocket Capital of the World'.

questions.text: Which state had the most military battles during the Revolutionary War?
questions.explanation:
South Carolina.

	South Carolina reportedly had about 137 battles during the war, 103 of them were fought without help from the other colonies.

questions.text: Which state has the world's most active volcano?
questions.explanation:
Hawaii.

	The crater of  Kilauea has the distinction of being the most active in the world.  Stromboli also claims this distinction.

questions.text: Virginia is the state to give the US the most native born presidents? How many presidents were native to Virginia?
questions.explanation:
8 & eight.

	William Henry Harrison, Thomas Jefferson, James Madison, James Monroe, Zachary Taylor, John Tyler, George Washington, Woodrow Wilson.

questions.text: What state is the US's leader in apple production?
questions.explanation:
Washington.

	Hope you enjoyed this trip around the USA.
